summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2021 among US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), NYPD, and FBI personnel regarding outreach to a person claiming to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant. The emails discuss following up on a tip from July 2021 where an individual offered information to help the prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; her assistant is the focus of the information being discussed.

events.title: Tip about Maxwell's assistant
events.description: An individual sends an email to the US Attorney's Office offering information about Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant, claiming it could help the prosecution.

events.title: Follow-up on assistant tip
events.description: US Attorney's Office, NYPD, and FBI personnel exchange emails following up on the July 2021 tip regarding Maxwell's assistant.

keyFacts: In July 2021, an individual contacted the US Attorney's Office claiming to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant that could aid the prosecution.
The tipster stated the assistant, referred to as 'her' and with the motto 'Kindness Matters', had lived with them while working for Epstein.
By September 2021, law enforcement (USANYS, NYPD, FBI) were coordinating follow-up efforts to reach this potential informant.
The email chain shows ongoing investigative efforts to gather information about Maxwell's associates post-conviction.
